title.value: scGeneRythm: Using Neural Networks and Fourier Transformation to Cluster Genes by Time-Frequency Patterns in Single-Cell Data
title.justification: This title accurately reflects the content and methodologies discussed in the paper, specifically the use of neural networks and Fourier transformation for gene clustering in single-cell RNA sequencing data.
title.quote: scGeneRythm: Using Neural Networks and Fourier Transformation to Cluster Genes by Time-Frequency Patterns in Single-Cell Data

extractions.description: This paper introduces scGeneRythm, an innovative method employing deep neural networks and Fourier transformation to capture both time and frequency domain patterns in single-cell RNA sequencing data for improved gene clustering. The method outperforms traditional time-domain methods and reveals intricate gene relationships and rhythms, enhancing biological insights in cellular and molecular research.

type.justification: The paper demonstrates the application of the scGeneRythm model on multiple single-cell RNA sequencing datasets, compares its performance with existing methods, and provides benchmarking results and analysis data.
type.quote: In extensive evaluations across diverse single-cell datasets, scGeneRythm consistently eclipsed its contemporaries, underscoring its superior gene clustering prowess.

name.justification: The paper focuses on gene clustering in single-cell RNA sequencing data, a primary aspect of single-cell genomics.
name.quote: Gene clustering in scRNA-seq analysis is paramount for deciphering this complexity, enabling insights into gene interactions, disease-associated genes, and the interplay between cell types and biological processes.

name.justification: The methodology involves computational techniques, including neural networks and Fourier transformation, to analyze and cluster gene expression data.
name.quote: To address the prevailing challenges in single-cell gene clustering, we present scGeneRythm, an innovative method anchored in a deep neural network framework.

name.justification: The paper discusses capturing holistic data, including temporal and frequency domain information, to understand complex biological systems and interactions in gene expression.
name.quote: This approach captures the rich tapestry of gene expression from both the time and frequency domains.

name.justification: The study utilizes bioinformatic tools and algorithms for pre-processing, analyzing, and extracting meaningful patterns from single-cell RNA sequencing data.
name.quote: Using the dataset’s temporal data, we identified the root node position of the trajectory and inferred each cell’s pseudotime within the partition.

name.justification: The scGeneRythm model is the primary deep learning model introduced and evaluated in the study.
name.quote: Recognizing this, we present scGeneRythm, an innovative deep learning technique that employs Fourier transformation.

is_contributed.justification: The scGeneRythm model is an original contribution introduced in this paper.
is_contributed.quote: we present scGeneRythm, an innovative deep learning technique that employs Fourier transformation.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed as part of the study to evaluate its performance on multiple datasets.
is_executed.quote: In extensive evaluations across diverse single-cell datasets, scGeneRythm consistently eclipsed its contemporaries, underscoring its superior gene clustering prowess.

is_compared.justification: The scGeneRythm model was compared with other contemporary methods in the study.
is_compared.quote: Benchmarking scGeneRythm against scSTEM was a methodologically sound endeavor... the Ranksum test, which yielded a P-value of 1.06 × 10−23 , significantly subverting the 0.05 threshold, thereby eloquently underlining the superior performance of scGeneRythm over scSTEM.

referenced_paper_title.justification: scGeneRythm is introduced in this paper, so there is no referenced paper for it.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Recognizing this, we present scGeneRythm, an innovative deep learning technique that employs Fourier transformation.

name.justification: The Mouse embryonic blood cells dataset was used to evaluate the scGeneRythm model's performance and effectiveness in identifying gene clusters.
name.quote: In the analysis of the Mouse embryonic blood cells dataset, scGeneRythm’s effectiveness in identifying gene clusters was prominently showcased.

referenced_paper_title.value: The single-cell transcriptional landscape of mammalian organogenesis
referenced_paper_title.justification: This referenced paper provides the dataset used for evaluating the scGeneRythm model.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The other datasets, sourced from ONCOSCAPE, contained 42,262 mouse embryonic blood cells [27].

name.justification: Seurat was used for the initial data processing, specifically for normalizing the single-cell cell-by-gene matrix and finding the variable genes.
name.quote: We then employed the Leiden algorithm [29] for clustering, with the resulting clusters representing distinct cell types or unique biological processes.

referenced_paper_title.value: Seurat: visual analytics for the integrated analysis of microarray data
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the main reference for Seurat, which was used for initial data preprocessing in the study.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Following the original study’s protocol, we selected the top 3,000 cell-type-specific marker genes. The other datasets, sourced from ONCOSCAPE, contained 42,262 mouse embryonic blood cells
